questions.question: Using the diagram above, explain how this system interacts with another in the body to maintain homeostasis.

choices.answer: circulatory and digestive interact to produce and deliver oxygen.
The digestive and excretory systems interact to produce and remove waste.
Respiratory and digestive work together to produce and transport nutrients.
Immune and digestive work together to protect against infection.

questions.question: Which body systems work together when you are sweating to maintain a certain level of salt and water?

choices.answer: Nervous system sends messages to musculoskeletal to reduce activity.
Respiratory system breathes faster sending messages to nervous system.
Circulatory system signals the excretory system to reduce urine production.
Nervous system sends signals to digestive to reduce absorption of water.

questions.question: Which two systems work together to pass antibodies from mother to fetus?

choices.answer: Excretory system of the mother transfers antibodies to the nervous system.
Circulatory transfers antibodies to the nervous system.
Reproductive transfers antibodies to immune to produce strong skeleton.
Reproductive transfers antibodies to immune of fetus to prevent disease.

questions.question: Which systems work together to transfer nutrients from mom to fetus?

choices.answer: Nervous system signals musculoskeletal system for proper development.
Circulatory decreases its volume of blood.
Nervous system decreases its signal to musculoskeletal.
Circulatory system increases its volume of blood to ensure nutrients.

questions.question: Which systems work together when you exercise to increase your pulse rate?

choices.answer: Body breaks down food for digestive system.
Body exercises with musculoskeletal and respiratory takes in more oxygen.
Body uses its excretory to eliminate waste.
Body uses musculoskeletal & circulatory pumps more blood and oxygen .

questions.question: How do the immune and nervous system work together when fighting a bacteria infection?

choices.answer: Nervous responds and alerts immune to produce more bacteria.
Immune responds and alerts the nervous system to reduce white blood cells.
Nervous system alerts immune system to increase white blood cells.

questions.question: What is the difference between the Ebola virus and bacterial pneumonia?

choices.answer: viruses are living and bacteria are not.
Viruses are non-living , but bacteria are living.
Viruses can be beneficial to other organisms but bacteria are infectious.
Viruses can replicate because they are living and bacteria cannot.

questions.question: Which statement best compares bacteria and fungi?

choices.answer: Both always cause infectious diseases.
Bacteria are living and fungi are not.
Both bacteria and fungi rely on organisms to reproduce and survive.
Most bacteria and fungi are harmless and may be beneficial

questions.question: What is the difference between Malaria (parasite) and HIV (Virus)?

choices.answer: Both rely on other living organisms to survive, viruses are usually good.
Both rely on other living organisms, parasites feed on the host.
Both are living and parasites depend on cells of living things to reproduce
Viruses break down dead plants and animals.

questions.question: Inhale, use oxygen to break down food and transport nutrients to and from the cells.

choices.answer: The respiratory, circulatory, and digestive systems.
The immune, excretory, and nervous systems
The reproductive, nervous, and digestive systems.
D. The musculoskeletal, circulatory, and reproductive systems.
